results.idea: Short-term news momentum from business sentiment
results.description: Use recent change in rp_css_business to capture momentum after strong business news. Applied SUGGESTION1 by using a primary high-userCount field rp_css_business; SUGGESTION2 not applied (no VECTOR fields); SUGGESTION3 applied: coverage=0.5 -> ts_backfill(...,5); SUGGESTION4 applied by choosing high userCount/alphaCount field. Kept KEEP_IN_MINDs: implementation concise, <=7 operators, <=2 datafields, no GROUP alone. Confidence set to 0.70 due to broad usage and literature on news momentum.

Capture surprise from rp_ess_earnings using short-window zscore. SUGGESTION1: single focused field rp_ess_earnings chosen for event signal; SUGGESTION2 not applicable; SUGGESTION3 applied ts_backfill(.,5); SUGGESTION4 applied (rp_ess_earnings high alphaCount). Respected KEEP_IN_MIND constraints. Confidence 0.72 because earnings event sentiment is predictive in many studies.

Use ts_delta of nws18_ghc_lna to capture accelerating analyst action. Applied SUGGESTION1 single field with high userCount; SUGGESTION2 no; SUGGESTION3 applied ts_backfill(...,7); SUGGESTION4 applied. Followed KEEP_IN_MIND limits. Confidence 0.65 given modest but meaningful signal from analyst changes.

results.idea: Reversion after extreme price-target sentiment move
results.description: Reverse extreme rp_css_ptg zscore to trade mean reversion in price-target related sentiment. SUGGESTION1 single field rp_css_ptg; SUGGESTION2 not applied; SUGGESTION3 used ts_backfill(...,10); SUGGESTION4 applied moderately. KEEP_IN_MIND honored. Confidence 0.58 — moderate expectance of reversion.

Combine rp_nip_inverstor (impact) with nws18_event_relevance to favor high-impact, highly relevant stories. SUGGESTION1 applied: two fields; SUGGESTION2 not applicable; SUGGESTION3 applied ts_backfill to both with d=5; SUGGESTION4 applied selecting rp_nip_inverstor high userCount. KEEP_IN_MIND: two datafields and <7 operators. Confidence 0.75 due to multiplicative amplification of impact and relevance.

Long names where rp_css_earnings > rp_css_revenue momentum (earnings sentiment outpacing revenue sentiment). SUGGESTION1 used two complementary fields; SUGGESTION2 no; SUGGESTION3 backfilled both with 7 days; SUGGESTION4 favored high-user fields. Kept implementation compact. Confidence 0.68 reflecting earnings-driven moves.

results.idea: Persistent positive editorial sentiment (business editorial average)
